title: Chaffles with Almond Flour Recipe
description: This chaffle recipe uses almond flour, an egg, and mozzarella to make 2 cheesy waffles that are perfect for a low-carb breakfast or sandwich!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Waffle Recipes Chaffles with Almond Flour 4.7 (51) 47 Reviews 12 Photos This chaffle recipe uses almond flour to create a more traditional waffle texture and help get rid of any eggy taste. These cheesy waffles are an overnight sensation in the low-carb/keto world. Seriously, try them, they're delicious! I use an inexpensive mini waffle maker (such as Dash Mini Maker Waffle) which produces perfect 4-inch chaffles. So many ways to use chaffles, the sky's the limit! Submitted by lutzflcat Updated on November 20, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 12 12 12 12 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 5 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 2 Yield: 2 4-inch chaffles Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 1 large egg 1 tablespoon blanched almond flour ¼ teaspoon baking powder ½ cup shredded mozzarella cheese cooking spray Directions Whisk egg, almond flour, and baking powder together in a bowl. Stir in mozzarella cheese; set batter aside. Preheat a waffle iron according to the manufacturer's instructions. Spray both sides of the preheated waffle iron with cooking spray. Pour 1/2 of the batter onto the waffle iron and spread it out from the center with a spoon. Close the waffle maker and cook until chaffle reaches your desired doneness, about 3 minutes. Carefully lift chaffle out of the waffle iron and repeat with remaining batter. Allow chaffles to cool and crisp up, about 2 to 3 minutes. Recipe Tip Use Cheddar cheese instead of mozzarella for a flavor variation. I Made It Print Nutrition Facts (per serving) 132 Calories 9g Fat 2g Carbs 11g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 2 Calories 132 % Daily Value * Total Fat 9g 12% Saturated Fat 4g 19% Cholesterol 111mg 37% Sodium 271mg 12% Total Carbohydrate 2g 1% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 1g Protein 11g 22% Calcium 268mg 21% Iron 1mg 3% Potassium 57mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. Add Your Photo Photos of Chaffles with Almond Flour 01 of 12 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 12 Photo by  StrongBrie1559 03/25/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow First time making this, OH WOW! I read other reviews and added bacon for my husband's turkey burger " bun" and liston soup mix as a seasoning. Didn't have mozarella , used fiesta blend cheese. They crisp up pretty fast too! 03 of 12 Photo by  SunnyScoop5858 04/24/2023 No Dash mini waffle makers available near me so I picked up a more traditional style. It worked great and since I plan on subbing these for bread it saves a cook cycle. Yummy. 04 of 12 Photo by  sherryleez 08/25/2022 I increased the recipe x4 and added some freshly fried chopped up bacon. Delicious!!! 05 of 12 Photo by  Cynthia Guzman Alaniz 02/20/2022 We love this recipe!! I doubled the recipe and added some everything but the bagel seasoning to make bacon egg and cheese breakfast sandwiches for myself and my husband.. delicious!!! 06 of 12 Photo by  Elizabeth Fife Kirby 12/13/2021 07 of 12 Photo by  OJdiditoo 10/12/2021 My Chaffle Philly steak was delicious! 08 of 12 Photo by  Birdie 04/02/2021 This was my first attempt at making a Chaffle. I made it according to directions and then I put it in my butter coated small skillet and put spinach, a slice of bacon, some sauted jalapeno peppers and some about 28 grams of cheddar cheese to melt, then added my tuna packet and it was incredible. I love sandwiches and have missed them, so this will be my go to from now on!!! Thank you for a delicious bread substitute recipe that was super easy!!! 09 of 12 Photo by  KC Billingslea 12/12/2020 10 of 12 Photo by  3juneaus 09/20/2020 These were so easy to make, and taste, look and smell just like traditional waffles. I did add a sprinkle of cinnamon to the batter, but otherwise followed the recipe exactly. With butter and sugar free syrup, these were wonderful! 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Pumpkin Chaffles 1 Rating Chaffles 14 Ratings Chestnut Flour Waffles (Gluten Free) 1 Rating Easy Vegan Banana Pancakes 8 Ratings Gluten-Free Waffles 37 Ratings Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookie Waffles 3 Ratings Coconut Chocolate Chip Waffles 12 Ratings Cathy's Gluten-Free Oatmeal Waffles 13 Ratings Green Waffles 2 Ratings Whole Grain Waffles 892 Ratings Carnation Chocolate Raspberry Breakfast Parfait 8 Ratings Protein Waffles 67 Ratings Paleo Applesauce Pancakes 21 Ratings Zucchini Waffles (Green Waffles) 13 Ratings Greek Yogurt Breakfast Parfait Homemade Waffles 14 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: lutzflcat
instructions: Whisk egg, almond flour, and baking powder together in a bowl. Stir in mozzarella cheese; set batter aside.;Preheat a waffle iron according to the manufacturer's instructions.;Spray both sides of the preheated waffle iron with cooking spray. Pour 1/2 of the batter onto the waffle iron and spread it out from the center with a spoon. Close the waffle maker and cook until chaffle reaches your desired doneness, about 3 minutes. Carefully lift chaffle out of the waffle iron and repeat with remaining batter. Allow chaffles to cool and crisp up, about 2 to 3 minutes.
